name: Chief Runamuk
text:
Nice evening. Play was entertaining. A murder mystery with lots of local flavor stirred in
Building is a bit dated. But what good theater isn't.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Love live theater! A fun time was had by all. Important, charming, well-supported community theater with live musical accompaniment. (For musicals only?) A great evening out which pairs well with a visit to the new waterfront grill around on highway 43. Theater doesn't  appear to ever repeat shows, which is catchy, but lose a little without benefit of adding shows to a repertoire (and then continually refine) to gain value of experience with production over time. Website offers no explanation of CURRENT directorship or "staff," but gather these differ from show to show. Likely necessary to keep going. Floors need good regular cleaning. Refreshments are homestyle quaint. Lottery-style offering of limited # of lesser expensive tickets ($5-7?) for select shows would broaden audience. Promote them to people in the surrounding neighborhoods especially. Keep on keeping on!

name: R J
text: Small town. Big talent. Been here for several performances. No not every actor is Broadway caliber but whatever they might lack in talent they make up for with enthusiasm and it's always fun. Give it a try!

name: dhelpfulhands
text: Visited this place to see 3CP Improv Comedy. We had a great time. It was good clean fun and family-oriented. It was a little hard to find because I'm not familiar with the area. We got a good parking spot and it was easy to get out once the event was over. I will be checking this place out to see what other events that they are going to host. I will also be looking at 3CP again because I enjoyed them!

name: Suzanne Coleman
text: Wonderful little theater. But wish you could pick your seats ahead of time.

text: It is so cool and nice I love this place

name: don rimmer
text: Had a great time watching guys and Dolls pretty funny you had a good plot and characters were really exciting

name: Gena Berchtold
text: Experienced the beautiful performance of The Little Mermaid.  The cast members were extremely talented. Performance and musical direction were outstanding and very professional.  This is a must see.

name: Ellen Carter
text: This is community theater. It's not professional but they try really hard. And they let people try being a director and stuff, so that's nice too.

text:
I just love all of the shows. Professional and very talented group of actors and actresses.
You can tell they put in 100% and work very hard.

name: Stephanie Melton
text:
Great cast in the play! The outside seating area is delightful. The people are very warm and welcoming.
Go see a play! Way better than T.V.

name: Quite Marvelous
text: As always, phenomenal!

name: Stacey Steiner
text:
I got my wires crossed. I thought have they were having a matinee of Rocky Horror Show. I knew it was coming up. I am used to JJP and Chickasaw. I had tried to buy tickets online last night. I got there a few minutes before 1:00 and waited until someone showed up to find out they aren't open on Sundays.

At least now I know why I haven't been there in a while! My fault, not theirs but I really enjoy Sunday matinees!

name: JR H
text: It was sold out on the last showing here so I did not choose to stay. But the local actors, directors and others do a great job here. I missed seeing a Steven Sondheim play here that must have been very well done since it sold out on the last show.

name: Candace Foster
text: The best theatre around! Dark & intimate, like a black box theatre. I love the mysterious vibe & the variety of shows put on. A theatre for all--especially if you're tired of the same old thing. Also, an awesome date night venue!

name: Sarah Parks
text: We really enjoyed the play. Just wasn't a good atmosphere for small children.  They serve alcohol and the workers where all drinking .

text: Nice and friendly peoples love this place
